scenario: > Sophomore in computer science at UIT2 Grenoble

1.title: BracketBuddy
1.description: Design and development of a desktop application for creating and managing basketball tournaments
1.longDescription: BracketBuddy is a desktop application developed as a team for the end-of-year project at UIT2. It allows users to create and manage basketball tournaments. The application features a user-friendly interface for creating teams, scheduling matches, managing venues and tracking tournament progress with real-time generation of the tournament tree based on scores.
keyPoints: Data storage via a serialization mechanism
Automatic handling of venue and event availability

2.title: Entour'Âge
2.description: Design and development of a web application aimed at easing the workload of family caregivers
2.longDescription: Entour'Âge is a collaborative platform dedicated to coordinating the circle of care around a dependent person. The application helps centralize essential information, organize daily interventions and facilitate communication between family members and healthcare professionals. By structuring medical and logistical follow-up, the tool aims to significantly reduce the mental load on the primary caregiver while securing home care.
keyPoints: Shared calendar to synchronize medical appointments and caregiver visits
Real-time tracking of the loved one's health status and daily needs
Secure communication space to break the isolation of the family caregiver
Centralization of administrative records and emergency contacts accessible in one click

3.title: Network Infrastructure
3.description: Design and implementation of a network infrastructure for a road traffic control service
3.longDescription: Group project consisting of implementing a complete infrastructure for a traffic control service (traffic lights). Security is a key element of this project, requiring the establishment of secure internal communication, DMZs and a robust firewall. The infrastructure must be comprehensive: running multiple client/server machines, administrator workstations, several networks and a wiki to ensure future management of the infrastructure.
keyPoints: Implementation of a Wiki to ensure infrastructure management
DNS server, DHCP and internal routers
Adaptability across multiple OS and security enhancement

4.title: Online Chat Application
4.description: Development of a minimalist instant messaging application for real-time communication
4.longDescription: Personal project designed to explore the development of dynamic web applications with the Flask framework and WebSockets. The application offers a simple and intuitive interface where users can join chat rooms to communicate instantly. The project includes user session management in a lightweight architecture for rapid deployment.
keyPoints: Chat room system to organize conversations
User session and ID management via Flask and WebSockets
Lightweight architecture optimized for hosting on PythonAnywhere

5.title: Minecraft Plugins
5.description: Development of plugins for multiplayer servers
5.longDescription: I designed and developed several Java plugins in a personal capacity to enrich the gaming experience on Minecraft servers. This work involved using the Spigot/Paper API to manipulate game logic: creating custom commands, managing complex events (listeners) and data persistence.
keyPoints: Creation of reactive systems for player actions (Events & Listeners)
Implementation of advanced commands with access permission management
Use of YAML configuration files and persistent data storage
Management of asynchronous tasks to preserve server performance
